intro: Sida repanda, commonly known as silky sida, is an annual herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It features slender, branching stems covered in fine, silky hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. The leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a velvety texture. Its small, white flowers are clustered in racemes and bloom throughout the growing season. The plant is often found in disturbed soils and is sometimes considered a weed in agricultural settings.
